meanings.sent1: The dentist found a cavitating tooth in the patient's mouth.
meanings.sent2: The cavitating rock had a hollow space inside.
meanings.sent3: The cavitating pumpkin was perfect for Halloween carving.
meanings.sent4: The cavitating tree trunk echoed with mysterious sounds.
meanings.sent5: The cavitating balloon collapsed in on itself, creating a unique shape.

meanings.sent1: The cavitating sponge soaked up all the water in the sink.
meanings.sent2: The cavitating sponge was soft and squishy to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The cavitating sponge seemed to have a never-ending thirst.
meanings.sent4: The cavitating sponge resembled a tiny, porous creature.
meanings.sent5: The cavitating sponge released bubbles as it absorbed liquid.

meanings.definition: To form a cavity or hole in something
meanings.sent1: The woodpecker was cavitating the old tree trunk with its beak.
meanings.sent2: The constant dripping water cavitating the stone over time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel cavitating acorns in the garden soil.
meanings.sent4: The drill was cavitating the metal surface with precision.
meanings.sent5: The river cavitating the canyon walls, creating a breathtaking landscape.
